info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 7 at 1:29PM MDT until August 7 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Rapid City SD
info.description:
...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 315 AND 322...
.A dry-line will continue to push through the area this afternoon resulting in very low relative humidities as low as 9 percent. West to southwest winds will blow at 10 to 20 mph with gusts to around 25 mph. High temperatures will push into the 90s. The result will be critical fire weather conditions this afternoon and early evening.
* AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zones 315 Southern Campbell and 322 Fall River County Area.
* WINDS...West 10 to 20 mph with gusts around 25 mph.
* RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 9 percent.
* IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

parameter.value: RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 315 AND 322

area.areaDesc: Fall River County Area; Southern Campbell
